ticket.title: rescue_from changes causing issues
ticket.original-body:
I'm trying to upgrade an app to edge to dig into the new i18n stuff, and I'm finding that my rescue_from calls aren't working. I'm wondering if it has something to do with this:
http://m.onkey.org/2008/7/20/rescue-from-dispatching
and
http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/90c930f45c5c6766306929241462ffff8f67b86e
Perhaps I'm doing something wrong, but things are working fine in 2.1 and I can't seem to figure out if I need to change anything. Here's how I'm doing things (with a combo of two files):
http://github.com/trevorturk/el-dorado/tree/master/app/controllers/application.rb
and
http://github.com/trevorturk/el-dorado/tree/master/lib/exception_handler.rb
My apologies if this is a mistake on my end. I haven't been able to figure out what I could be doing wrong.

version.title: rescue_from changes causing issues

version.body:
I should have attached an example error I'm receiving in my tests:
http://pastie.org/237545
This exception should be caught as described in the test:
http://pastie.org/237546
version.body-html:
I should have attached an example error I'm receiving in my tests:

http://pastie.org/237545

This exception should be caught as described in the test:

http://pastie.org/237546
version.title: rescue_from changes causing issues

version.body:
Trevor,
Does it work if you revert that changeset ?
version.body-html:
Trevor,

Does it work if you revert that changeset ?
version.title: rescue_from changes causing issues

version.body:
Yeah, if I vendor from this commit:
http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/f7d08acd5e0650658383e3d3f86d6ff5b49e9030
(which is before the one we're talking about) then things work fine. Actually, the calendar_date_select plugin is causing some errors, but the errors that are making me think that rescue_from wasn't working are gone.
I can't guarantee that I'm doing everything the way you're supposed to, but it does look suspiciously related to that commit.
version.body-html:
Yeah, if I vendor from this commit:

http://github.com/rails/rails/co...

(which is before the one we're talking about) then things work fine. Actually, the calendar_date_select plugin is causing some errors, but the errors that are making me think that rescue_from wasn't working are gone.

I can't guarantee that I'm doing everything the way you're supposed to, but it does look suspiciously related to that commit.
version.title: rescue_from changes causing issues

version.body:
This happening because you have following in your tests :
@@@ ruby # Re-raise errors caught by the controller. class HomeController; def rescue_action(e) raise e end; end @@@
version.body-html:
This happening because you have following in your tests : 

# Re-raise errors caught by the controller.
class HomeController; def rescue_action(e) raise e end; end
version.title: rescue_from changes causing issues

version.body:
I see. Thanks very much for tracking that down.
Perhaps this would be worth mentioning as a gotcha on the next release? I'm pretty sure that the Rails generator added that stuff in there for me, so it could be that this problem would bite a lot of people.
I'll clean up my functional tests to look like what's generated with edge rails now. Thanks again.
version.body-html:
I see. Thanks very much for tracking that down.

Perhaps this would be worth mentioning as a gotcha on the next release? I'm pretty sure that the Rails generator added that stuff in there for me, so it could be that this problem would bite a lot of people.

I'll clean up my functional tests to look like what's generated with edge rails now. Thanks again.
version.title: rescue_from changes causing issues

version.body: Yeah, old generators added that. I wonder if there's a clean way to throw the warning.
version.body-html: Yeah, old generators added that. I wonder if there's a clean way to throw the warning.
version.title: rescue_from changes causing issues

version.body:
Sorry to be a bother, but I'm still not able to get this working.
I've made a new app on rails edge, and I'm able to get exceptions rescued in development mode, but the tests are still failing. Perhaps I'm doing something obvious wrong, but I can't seem to figure it out.
Here's the commit that shows what I'm doing:
http://github.com/trevorturk/rails-2.2-i18n-example/commit/197596a706b00f9c7bcc17baa88d08c37738afd9
...and the test results:
http://pastie.org/237594
version.body-html:
Sorry to be a bother, but I'm still not able to get this working.

I've made a new app on rails edge, and I'm able to get exceptions rescued in development mode, but the tests are still failing. Perhaps I'm doing something obvious wrong, but I can't seem to figure it out.

Here's the commit that shows what I'm doing:

http://github.com/trevorturk/rai...

...and the test results:

http://pastie.org/237594
version.title: rescue_from changes causing issues

version.body: You'll need to test it in an integration test as functional tests are tied to a specific controller.
version.body-html:
You'll need to test it in an integration test as functional tests are

tied to a specific controller.
version.title: rescue_from changes causing issues

version.body: Ahh, that finally did it. Thanks again for your help, and I'm very sorry to have bothered you. I do think that this change might impact people with older applications that use generated tests, but it's easy enough to fix once you know what's going on. Thanks!
version.body-html: Ahh, that finally did it. Thanks again for your help, and I'm very sorry to have bothered you. I do think that this change might impact people with older applications that use generated tests, but it's easy enough to fix once you know what's going on. Thanks!
version.title: rescue_from changes causing issues
